qas.question: How old can my pcr test be until it is no longer valid when entering fiji?

answers.text: no more than one day prior to the scheduled day of departure

qas.question: Who is allowed to enter fiji?

answers.text: Only fully vaccinated travellers are able to enter Fiji

qas.question: What does the fiji government require for tourist when they enter the country?

answers.text: Fiji government requires travellers coming for tourist purposes to have medical travel insurance that covers COVID-19

paragraphs.context: The Fiji government has reduced the time when this test can be taken to no more than one day prior to the scheduled day of departure or the first flight in a series of connections booked on the same itinerary. This change is now in effect for those departing from the UK and USA. Only fully vaccinated travellers are able to enter Fiji and the vaccine must be of a type approved by the Fijian authorities. You will also need to ensure you meet testing and vaccination requirements of your airline and any countries transited enroute to Fiji. Fiji government requires travellers coming for tourist purposes to have medical travel insurance that covers COVID-19.

qas.question: What do i need to have to be able to transit through fiji?

answers.text: you have a valid ticket, negative COVID-19 test and are fully vaccinated

qas.question: What should i do if i want to leave fiji as a foreign national?

answers.text: have been advised to contact Fiji Immigration Office

qas.question: What can the fiji immigration office help me with?

answers.text: properly guided to maintain their legal status

paragraphs.context: You may transit Nadi Airport from Travel Partner countries if you have a valid ticket, negative COVID-19 test and are fully vaccinated. All foreign nationals who are currently unable to leave Fiji have been advised to contact Fiji Immigration Office so that they may be properly guided to maintain their legal status. This applies to all categories of permit holders.
